question: What is the relationship of fyn kinase and tau?
ideal_answer: The Fyn kinase interacts with tau. The activated Fyn kinase hyperphosphorylates the tau protein.

snippets.text: Fyn is an attractive target for AD therapeutics, not only based on its activation by Aβ via cellular prion protein but also due to its known interaction with tau, uniquely linking the two key pathologies in AD.
This PrPC-Aβo complex activates Fyn kinase which, in turn, hyperphosphorylates tau (P-Tau) resulting in synaptic dysfunction, neuronal loss and cognitive deficits.
